paper_title.ja: 自作電子衝撃加熱装置による高融点チタン金属の真空蒸発
表面・界面工学大系 上巻 基礎編

publication_name.ja: フジ・テクノシステム

paper_title.ja: 新訂版・表面科学の基礎と応用
21世紀版薄膜作製応用ハンドブック
エネルギーフィルター型RHEED－AESによる表面研究

description.ja: RHEED is one of the powerful tools for surface studies and monitoring thin film growth. RHEED pattern provides information on surface structures, surface morphology and thin film crystallography. Further more information including inelastic scattering can be obtained by installation of energy-filter in RHEED apparatus. We present a newly constructed energy-loss measurement system for diffracted electrons and demonstrate the experimental data obtained from Si(111)7×7 surface. For the morphology of regular step surface, it is shown that the mean terrace length can be evaluated by the energy-filtered RHEED pattern of the vicinal Si surface. Reflected electron beams from a specimen surface into vacuum are usually concerned in conventional RHEED. On the other hand, it is shown that the incident electron density distribution (wave field) formed in a crystal surface is useful to clarify the causes of the complicated peaks in the rocking curve. This approach is also effective for surface structural study using Auger excitation at selected atomic rows.
description.en: RHEED is one of the powerful tools for surface studies and monitoring thin film growth. RHEED pattern provides information on surface structures, surface morphology and thin film crystallography. Further more information including inelastic scattering can be obtained by installation of energy-filter in RHEED apparatus. We present a newly constructed energy-loss measurement system for diffracted electrons and demonstrate the experimental data obtained from Si(111)7×7 surface. For the morphology of regular step surface, it is shown that the mean terrace length can be evaluated by the energy-filtered RHEED pattern of the vicinal Si surface. Reflected electron beams from a specimen surface into vacuum are usually concerned in conventional RHEED. On the other hand, it is shown that the incident electron density distribution (wave field) formed in a crystal surface is useful to clarify the causes of the complicated peaks in the rocking curve. This approach is also effective for surface structural study using Auger excitation at selected atomic rows.

paper_title.ja: 半導体基板上に成長する絶縁膜の成長様式と表面形態
paper_title.en: Growth mode and surface morphology of insulator film grown on semiconductor substrate

description.ja: We have investigated the growth mode and surface morphology of CaF_2 film on Si (111) 7×7 substrate by reflection high-energy electron diffraction (RHEED) using very weak electron beam and atomic force microscopy (AFM). It was found by RHEED intensity oscillation measurements and AFM observations that three-dimensional (3D) islands grow at RT, however, rather flat surface appears with 2D islands around 300℃. Especially, at high temperature of 700℃, characteristic equilateral triangular terraces (or islands) with flat and wide shape grow with the tops directed toward [11-2] of substrate Si (111). On the other hand, desorption process of the CaF_2 film due to electron stimulated desorption (BSD) was also examined. It was found that the ESD process at 300℃ forms characteristic equilateral triangular craters on the film surface with the tops (or corners) directed toward [-1-12] of substrate Si (111), provided that the film was grown at 700℃. In addition, solid phase epitaxy of CaF_2 film on Si (001) 2×1 substrate has been investigated and CaF_2 (110) growth was observed at the interface.
description.en: We have investigated the growth mode and surface morphology of CaF_2 film on Si (111) 7×7 substrate by reflection high-energy electron diffraction (RHEED) using very weak electron beam and atomic force microscopy (AFM). It was found by RHEED intensity oscillation measurements and AFM observations that three-dimensional (3D) islands grow at RT, however, rather flat surface appears with 2D islands around 300℃. Especially, at high temperature of 700℃, characteristic equilateral triangular terraces (or islands) with flat and wide shape grow with the tops directed toward [11-2] of substrate Si (111). On the other hand, desorption process of the CaF_2 film due to electron stimulated desorption (BSD) was also examined. It was found that the ESD process at 300℃ forms characteristic equilateral triangular craters on the film surface with the tops (or corners) directed toward [-1-12] of substrate Si (111), provided that the film was grown at 700℃. In addition, solid phase epitaxy of CaF_2 film on Si (001) 2×1 substrate has been investigated and CaF_2 (110) growth was observed at the interface.

publication_name.en: A bulletin of Daido Technical College

paper_title.ja: RHEED波動場によるオージェ電子強度変化
paper_title.en: Auger Electron Intensity Change by Wave Field of RHEED

description.ja: Reflection high-energy electron diffraction (RHEED) is one of the most powerful techniques for surface investigation. The diffraction pattern is usually used as information source on the surface structure. On the other hand, much attention has not been paid to electron wave field (electron density distribution) of RHEED, which is constructed near the crystal surface by the incident and diffracted electron beams. In order to inspect the existence of the wave filed, Auger electron intensities excited by RHEED have been measured for Si(111)√3×√3-Al surfaces. Auger electron intensities of Si(LVV) and Al(LMM) were measured by a cylindrical mirror analyzer (CMA) and by a retarding field analyzer (RFA) by changing the glancing angle of the incident electron beam. Intensity distributions of the electron wave field were calculated on the basis of the dynamical diffraction theory. It has been found that the experimentally obtained Auger intensity anomalies and calculated wave fields are correlated to each other.
description.en: Reflection high-energy electron diffraction (RHEED) is one of the most powerful techniques for surface investigation. The diffraction pattern is usually used as information source on the surface structure. On the other hand, much attention has not been paid to electron wave field (electron density distribution) of RHEED, which is constructed near the crystal surface by the incident and diffracted electron beams. In order to inspect the existence of the wave filed, Auger electron intensities excited by RHEED have been measured for Si(111)√3×√3-Al surfaces. Auger electron intensities of Si(LVV) and Al(LMM) were measured by a cylindrical mirror analyzer (CMA) and by a retarding field analyzer (RFA) by changing the glancing angle of the incident electron beam. Intensity distributions of the electron wave field were calculated on the basis of the dynamical diffraction theory. It has been found that the experimentally obtained Auger intensity anomalies and calculated wave fields are correlated to each other.

paper_title.en: Observation of triangular terraces and triangular craters of CaF2 film on Si(111) substrate
Energy-Filtered Reflection High-Energy Electron Diffraction Apparatus Combined with Energy-Loss Measurement System
Structural study of Al deposited surface on Si(1 1 1)√3×√3-Al

description.en: Room temperature deposition of Al on Si(1 1 1)√3×√3-Al surface shows two-dimensional growth mode and results in an excellent epitaxial film of Al(1 1 1). Especially, in the initial growth stage, a transient behavior is observed in the RHEED intensity oscillation curve of the specular beam. By means of dynamical analysis of the RHEED rocking curves, the transient surface structure has been clarified as entirely filled T4 site (EFT) structure, where deposited 2/3 monolayer Al atoms sit on the residual 2/3 monolayer T4 sites and the height is slightly lower than that of initially situated 1/3 monolayer Al atoms at T4 sites of Si(1 1 1)√3×√3-Al structure. The EFT surface structure is considered to play an important part leading to the excellent epitaxial growth of Al(1 1 1).

paper_title.ja: エネルギーフィルター型RHEED図形内の振動相関熱散漫散乱
paper_title.en: Correlated Thermal Diffuse Scattering in Energy-Filtered RHEED Pattern

description.ja: Electron thermal diffuse scattering constructs the background intensity in electron diffraction pattern. The scattering component accompanied with vibrational correlation between the nearest neighbor atoms in crystal, which is named as correlated thermal diffuse scattering (CTDS), is also included in the background. Recently a new direct structural analysis method has been proposed in medium electron energy diffraction (MEED) by extracting CTDS intensity distribution from the background by means of energy filter. In order to examine the existence of CTDS intensity distribution in the case of reflection high-energy electron diffraction (RHEED), the energy filtered (EF-) RHEED patterns from Si(001)2x1 clean surface were taken by CCD camera and the images were processed by personal computer in order to eliminate the background profile. The preliminary result of CTDS pattern has been obtained for the first time from EF-RHEED. An appropriate distance between the nearest neighbor Si atoms was deduced from Fourier transformation of the CTDS pattern. It is found that the direct structural analysis using CTDS in EF-RHEED is possible as a complementary method to dynamical structural analysis using rocking curves of diffraction spot intensities.
description.en: Electron thermal diffuse scattering constructs the background intensity in electron diffraction pattern. The scattering component accompanied with vibrational correlation between the nearest neighbor atoms in crystal, which is named as correlated thermal diffuse scattering (CTDS), is also included in the background. Recently a new direct structural analysis method has been proposed in medium electron energy diffraction (MEED) by extracting CTDS intensity distribution from the background by means of energy filter. In order to examine the existence of CTDS intensity distribution in the case of reflection high-energy electron diffraction (RHEED), the energy filtered (EF-) RHEED patterns from Si(001)2x1 clean surface were taken by CCD camera and the images were processed by personal computer in order to eliminate the background profile. The preliminary result of CTDS pattern has been obtained for the first time from EF-RHEED. An appropriate distance between the nearest neighbor Si atoms was deduced from Fourier transformation of the CTDS pattern. It is found that the direct structural analysis using CTDS in EF-RHEED is possible as a complementary method to dynamical structural analysis using rocking curves of diffraction spot intensities.

paper_title.ja: EF-RHEED図形内の微傾斜Si(001)表面のステップ情報
paper_title.en: Surface Step Information of Vicinal Si(001)in EF-RHEED Pattern

description.ja: For a vicinal Si(001) 2×1 surface, a row of extra spots has been clearly observed along the reciprocal lattice rod in energy-filtered reflection high-energy electron diffraction (ER-RHEED) pattern. The glancing angle dependence of these extra spots along (0 0), (1/2 0) and (1 0) rods was simulated by kinematical analysis based on a monatomic regular step surface. Behavior of these extra spots was reproduced well by the calculations and the mean terrace length along the [110] direction was estimated. It has been found that this method can evaluate very small vicinal angle near 0.1<SUP>o</SUP>, which is superior to low energy electron diffraction (LEED) method in this point.
description.en: For a vicinal Si(001) 2×1 surface, a row of extra spots has been clearly observed along the reciprocal lattice rod in energy-filtered reflection high-energy electron diffraction (ER-RHEED) pattern. The glancing angle dependence of these extra spots along (0 0), (1/2 0) and (1 0) rods was simulated by kinematical analysis based on a monatomic regular step surface. Behavior of these extra spots was reproduced well by the calculations and the mean terrace length along the [110] direction was estimated. It has been found that this method can evaluate very small vicinal angle near 0.1<SUP>o</SUP>, which is superior to low energy electron diffraction (LEED) method in this point.

publisher.ja: The Surface Science Society of Japan
publisher.en: The Surface Science Society of Japan

paper_title.ja: 微傾斜Si(001)表面からのEF-RHEED図形
paper_title.en: EF-RHEED Pattern Observed from Vicinal Si(001) Surface

description.ja: Extra spots near the Bragg reflection spots have been clearly observed for a vicinal Si(001)2x1 surface by energy-filtered reflection high-energy electron diffraction (ER-RHEED) at [1-10] incidence with 10 kV electron beam. The extra spots are distributed along a normal line across the Bragg reflection spots, 0 0, 1/2 0 and 1 0. From the glancing angle dependence of the extra spots, the mean terrace length along the [1-10] direction was reasonably estimated by kinematical calculations based on a regularly arranged step surface with single step height. It is shown that this method can evaluate very small vicinal angle near 0.1°, which is superior to low energy electron diffraction (LEED) method.
description.en: Extra spots near the Bragg reflection spots have been clearly observed for a vicinal Si(001)2x1 surface by energy-filtered reflection high-energy electron diffraction (ER-RHEED) at [1-10] incidence with 10 kV electron beam. The extra spots are distributed along a normal line across the Bragg reflection spots, 0 0, 1/2 0 and 1 0. From the glancing angle dependence of the extra spots, the mean terrace length along the [1-10] direction was reasonably estimated by kinematical calculations based on a regularly arranged step surface with single step height. It is shown that this method can evaluate very small vicinal angle near 0.1°, which is superior to low energy electron diffraction (LEED) method.

publication_name.en: A bulletin of Daido Technical College

paper_title.en: Observation of CaF_2 Growht on Si(111)7×7 Surface by RHEED

description.ja: Thin film growth of CaF<sub>2</sub> on Si(111)7×7 depending on the substrate temperature has been studied by Reflection High-Energy Electron Diffraction (RHEED). In this study, three aspects such as solid-phase epitaxy, vapor-phase epitaxy and electron stimulated desorption (ESD) effect were investigated. In the solid-phase epitaxy, a 7×1 surface structure has been newly found at a very narrow temperature range of 840-850<sup>o</sup>C. In the vapor-phase epitaxy, RHEED intensity oscillations were observed at the substrate temperature range of 100-450<sup>o</sup>C, which suggests a layer by layer growth due to 2-dimensional nuclei. In the range of 500-700<sup>o</sup>C, the oscillation disappears but the reflection intensity is kept at a high level, which suggests a step-flow growth mode. It was judged from the change of Kikuchi pattern that CaF<sub>2</sub> thin films grown at the substrate temperature range of 200-700<sup>o</sup>C were all of type-B; however, that grown at 100<sup>o</sup>C was of type-A. Since the ESD effect on the CaF<sub>2</sub> surface is generally serious, the effect is also examined.
description.en: Thin film growth of CaF<sub>2</sub> on Si(111)7×7 depending on the substrate temperature has been studied by Reflection High-Energy Electron Diffraction (RHEED). In this study, three aspects such as solid-phase epitaxy, vapor-phase epitaxy and electron stimulated desorption (ESD) effect were investigated. In the solid-phase epitaxy, a 7×1 surface structure has been newly found at a very narrow temperature range of 840-850<sup>o</sup>C. In the vapor-phase epitaxy, RHEED intensity oscillations were observed at the substrate temperature range of 100-450<sup>o</sup>C, which suggests a layer by layer growth due to 2-dimensional nuclei. In the range of 500-700<sup>o</sup>C, the oscillation disappears but the reflection intensity is kept at a high level, which suggests a step-flow growth mode. It was judged from the change of Kikuchi pattern that CaF<sub>2</sub> thin films grown at the substrate temperature range of 200-700<sup>o</sup>C were all of type-B; however, that grown at 100<sup>o</sup>C was of type-A. Since the ESD effect on the CaF<sub>2</sub> surface is generally serious, the effect is also examined.

paper_title.ja: 表面処理技術ハンドブック -接着・塗装から電子材料まで-
Surface Morphology of Growing Al on Si(111)7$\times$7 and Si(111)$\sqrt{3}\times\sqrt{3}$–Al Substrates by Reflection High-Energy Electron Diffraction
paper_title.en: Surface Morphology of Growing Al on Si((]G0003[))7×7 and Si((]G0003[))┣D83┫D8×┣D83┫D8-Al Substrates by Reflection High-Energy Electron Diffraction

description.ja: Morphology of thin Al films grown on Si(111)$7{\times}7$ and Si(111)$\sqrt{3}\times\sqrt{3}$–Al substrates was investigated by glancing angle dependent reflection high-energy electron diffraction (RHEED). Comparing the experimental RHEED patterns with the calculated ones based on the refraction effect and Laue function at each glancing angle, the averaged slope angle of the deposited Al islands and the averaged domain size are estimated for both the systems. The morphological differences between the two systems are quantitatively clarified.
description.en: Morphology of thin Al films grown on Si(111)$7{\times}7$ and Si(111)$\sqrt{3}\times\sqrt{3}$–Al substrates was investigated by glancing angle dependent reflection high-energy electron diffraction (RHEED). Comparing the experimental RHEED patterns with the calculated ones based on the refraction effect and Laue function at each glancing angle, the averaged slope angle of the deposited Al islands and the averaged domain size are estimated for both the systems. The morphological differences between the two systems are quantitatively clarified.
